column1: With apologies to Gidget.I'm a bit tired of reading through all the arguments about why Indonesia does or doesn't have coronavirus and what is and isn't fake news on this thread https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/ShowTopic-g29… So this post is just for what is happening in Bali at the moment. Rumours, mask availability, any reports of someone having flu-like symptoms, any flight disruptions, that kind of thing. If you want to discuss whether there is a cover-up and what the various news and medical sites are saying about coronavirus in Indonesia, please go to the other thread.

Hello Mel, all good in Legian and Seminyak atm. Masks are available in Carrefour but no one is wearing them out and about. It stills appears busy to me but the locals are reporting it’s very quiet, they are all getting excited about Galungan on the 19th Feb with preparations well underway.
Thanks Glenn. I think I will get a mask before leaving Oz for the airport, even if it's just a psychological support mask. I was in Ubud once for Galungan once, it was really fun and festive. Enjoy!

It is not really necessary to wear a mask. it is more vital that you keep your hands clean and away from your face.Most masks will not prevent bacteria getting into the sides unless you get the N95.Take plenty of antiseptic wipes Aqium.https://www.theguardian.com/world/video/2020…

Virus only attack weak person, so the statistic death of 2019nCov is 80percent above 60 years old. Virus has self limited life. Eat well with high protein, sleep well, do not too tired. Regulars visitor know a lot to maintain healthiness without a rush.
Ha, knew it. Didn't take long did it Mel?

Sigh....you cannot keep Sawa G from posting the same stuff he posted on the other thread. We will all be reading the same posts twice now.MelMMMM, hate to ask but would you consider deleting your thread?

-:- Message from Tripadvisor staff -:-Tripadvisor staff removed this post because it did not meet Tripadvisor's forum guideline with regards to harassment of another user. We will remove messages that include personal attacks or hostility directed at an individual user or group of users, threatening language or attempts to force a user to discontinue participation on our forums.To review the Tripadvisor Forums Posting Guidelines, please follow this link: http://www.tripadvisor.com/pages/forums_posting_guidelines.htmlWe remove posts that do not follow our posting guidelines, and we reserve the right to remove any post for any reason.Removed on: 3:33 am, February 10, 2020
He invades threads with persistent repetition. He doesn't realise it's good to have a say, but not 100 times.
And I am under a self imposed ban on posting until my HNR starting March 12. Too much stress for me. Will report in a months time when on the ground. Richard.

-:- Message from Tripadvisor staff -:-This post has been removed at the author's request. The author may repost if desired.Posts on the Tripadvisor forums may be edited for a short period of time. Once the edit period has expired, authors may update their posts by removing and reposting them.To read more about editing your posts, please follow this link: http://www.tripadvisor.com/help/how_to_edit_your_postsRemoved on: 11:27 pm, February 08, 2020
Looking forward to your HNR Richard. I'll try and beat you to it!
Haha. You are correct Mac. Never heard anything different, even when there's a few of you at the same time, at their shop/stall.

My Singaporean friend who is currently working in Bali said all is still okay in Bali. I asked if he can purchase masks and hand sanitizers in advance for me and he told me don’t be silly. LOLL I’m arriving in two weeks time. Hope all is well still.
Singaporean maybe correct, although Singapore has Orange Status. This is the first post about it.

I’m looking forward to the HNR’s from you guys. I’ll be there 22March and can’t wait to read about all the fun you’re having.I won’t be taking/wearing masks, but will be using hand sanitizer (which I always do anyway) but will probably take anti bacterial wipes for plane and toilets etc (which I’ve never done).
My thread seems to be hijacked by Sarwa...I posted it purely for info...thanks for the apology to by the way Mel xEdited: 2:23 am, February 09, 2020
Love your comment Mac. Spot on.
